did.unittitle: American Song Sheets
did.abstract: This collection consists of American song sheets without music from the mid-19th century.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Most of the song sheets were published or printed by J. Andrews and H. De Marsan of New York and J. H. Johnson of Philadelphia. Some have the ink stamp of T. C. Boyd, 228 Montgomery, San Francisco. The list was compiled by the Zamboni & Huntington, booksellers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by song title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of American song sheets without music from the mid-19th century. Included are ballads, patriotic songs, Irish songs, love songs, etc. Most of the items have illustrated borders, some of which are colored. The entry for each item includes a caption title; any composer, performer or author information from the piece; the first line of the text, number of verses and chorus if present; name of melody; place and publisher or printer; date if given; printing details, such as border design; and a reference to Edwin Wolf's American song sheets, slip ballads, and poetical broadsides 1850-1870: a catalogue of the collection of the Library Company of Philadelphia.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], American Song Sheets, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

20. Banks of the Old Mohawk. - On the banks of the Old Mohawk (3 verses.) New York: Andrews, n.d. Border: Typographical ornament. Not in Wolf.
